intro: Phelipanche heldreichii, commonly known as the Balkan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale purple to white flowers. The plant has hairy, slender stems that often lie prostrate or ascending on the ground. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered with fine pubescence. Phelipanche heldreichii is an annual herb that thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
